data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3379639,"name":"Ethan C","username":"ethanc8","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-03T19:20:49.849Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eFor a long time, OpenCV’s Python bindings have been solely documented through the C++ Doxygen API docs. cv2’s API is not exactly the same as the C++ API, as it’s bridged to NumPy rather than using cv::Mat and similar types. It also isn’t trivial to build documentation for cv2 using the normal Python tools, as the docstrings are written in Doxygen rather than reStructuredText. I wrote a tool to parse these docstrings and use the Python \u003ccode\u003east\u003c/code\u003e module to parse the type stubs (\u003ccode\u003e*.pyi\u003c/code\u003e files) which document the types of the attributes and functions. You can find that code here: \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/ethanc8/opencv-doc-parser\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eGitHub - ethanc8/opencv-doc-parser\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eUsing this tool, I’ve started some work-in-progress API docs for \u003ccode\u003ecv2\u003c/code\u003e. So far, I have docs for \u003ccode\u003ecv2.aruco\u003c/code\u003e here: \u003ca href=\"https://ethanc8.github.io/opencv-python-docs/aruco.html\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ecv2.aruco - OpenCV Python API 4.9.0 documentation\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI started an OpenCV Discourse thread: \u003ca href=\"https://forum.opencv.org/t/opencv-python-api-docs/17519\" class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eOpenCV Python API docs -
